title: New: Saint Savanna – The Lunatic Spell EP
content:
Barely out of school, Brighton trio Saint Savanna showcase a songwriting ability well beyond their modest years.

Having initially (and with a pinch of salt) compared their debut EP, Verona, to destroys of music, Mumford & Sons, their newest release The Lunatic Spell banishes any possible Mumford aftertaste, whilst maintaining the pop vibe that attracted me to them in the first place. The Lunatic Spell toys with the dark, foreboding themes that littered their debut release; mental turmoil, the pains of growing up and an overarching sense of heartbreak induced loneliness. EP opener With Haste is far and away the most immediate, with it’s Alt-J inspired vocals and tales of short-lived yet shattering holiday romances. Having washed off any one-hit wonder doubts, Saint Savanna have ascerted their place as one of the UK’s most exciting new bands. Check out With Haste below, then grab the full EP as a free download.
